page.title: 16BALMANNO FARM MARYKIRK 1
page.content: Balmanno Farm covers 257 acres of which 254 are cultivated. At Balmanno, which is a small farm, a variety of crops is grown. The crops include spring barley, winter barley, winter wheat, oil seed rape, triticale (which is a cross between rye and wheat), protein peas, turnips, calabrese, cauliflower, brussels sprouts, leeks, potatoes, early and late cabbage, strawberries and raspberries. The barley is used for beer, whisky and cattlefeed. The winter wheat will be used for bread. From oil seed rape we get cooking oils and margarine and the crushed seeds are used for cattle feed as are triticale,protein peas and turnips.
